Key Match Events: Robbie Brady scored the winning goal in the 88th minute of the match.
Ireland recovered from an early error by Nathan Collins to turn around the fortunes of the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Heimir Hallgrimsson's reign as the Ireland national team coach is up and running.
Ireland's worrying descent was halted in Helsinki, thanks to Robbie Brady.
Liam Scales is a man for European nights, having scored in a European match recently.
Post-Match Reflections: Brady is one of the great survivors, having fought back from injury and delivered a big goal for his country.
Ireland needs leaders to step up and Nathan Collins' performance was disappointing in handing the opposing team a goal.
Aaron Connolly, who previously struggled with alcohol addiction, could bring something special to the national team if he finds form with Sunderland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland secured their first ever away win in the Nations League.
The match was crucial for Ireland to halt their worrying descent and secure a victory from somewhere.
